content: I have not tried to set up a gmasil in 128, but I am having no issues with oauth generally with gmail. Why are you creating a new account in Thunderbird? Is there some issue with the update, or is it just today you needed to add an account.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I'm just setting up a new windows laptop. This was the first attempt to add gmail to Thunderbird 128 - it's not upgrading from any previous installation. I'm using the same M$ account and nothing was there when I installed it on this computer. Should there be?

The error I receive from google is: "400. That’s an error.

The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That’s all we know."

I've had no problem with earlier versions of Thunderbird and gmail.
creator: bob364

content:
Eh, it was user error. I had accept cookies turned off in Tbird. Set it to accept cookies and it authed okay.

Solved.
creator: bob364

content: You need to change the authentication method to OAuth. That is all, unless other parts of your account settings are not up to date.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Do you see the same issue in troubleshooting mode? It is on the help menu and you should continue when prompted.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Perhaps if you were to share the actual error message. Verbatim please!

Having some idea of what version of Thunderbird you are using would also be helpful as we only know what you tell us about you, your setup and your issue.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Have you restarted your device since then? I suggest you do if you have not
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Are you asking about your junk filter https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages or your filters generally. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters

For filters generally the filters are stored in the messagefilter.dat file. One per account in the account directory. For general junk filtering the information is stored in the training.dat file. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1205408
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
You might want to ensure your server is SMTP.office365.com and the authentication method is OAuth. Apparently that is the only authentication Microsoft will permit after the 16 September if all the posts using that date in this forum are to be believed. To use OAuth in Thunderbird with Microsoft mail site you have to use the server names office365.

There also has to be a Thunderbird restart between changing the server name and setting the authentication method to OAuth.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Already aware of that and is in OP. TB detects all the "correct" settings.
